Reviews.Title: Great value for a cost effective outdoor IP camera solution
Reviews.Author: justChill "Knowledge will be the key resource...
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my satisfactory experience with the Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera Built-in Microphone With Phone remote monitoring support(Black) indoor IP camera. While this outdoor IP camera is branded as an Agasio, it is clearly made by Easy N Tech from the packaging and the model number. The clue was the Easy N Tech tagline on the box: "We Never Stop Trying!" After successfully setting this camera up and linking it with my indoor IP camera, it's safe to say that I've developed brand loyalty to Easy N Tech branded IP cameras (aka Foscam, Wansview, Hootoo, Apexis, etc.) despite plethora of generally negative reviews written by consumers who are not fully technologically equipped to optimally setup these IP cameras.I ordered this camera to monitor my 13' x 8' enclosed apartment patio which I've converted into a makeshift tortoise habitat for my Sulcata and Red Foot tortoises.The Camera:I'll start by reviewing the camera build. The camera is surprisingly heavy duty and well built to combat outdoor elements. It weighs about 2.2 lbs and holding it felt like holding a brick. It appears to be waterproof and has a metal hood that extends about 1.5" over the lens to prevent water or snow from landing on it. The package includes a installation CD, AC adapter, wall mounted bracket and screws(which I found to be very flimsy), the camera and a screw-on WiFi antenna. The packaging is pretty neat and the camera's built is ideal to where I'll be mounting it: outdoor year-round.Performance:The camera performs exceedingly well. It's fixed position so you can't pan or tilt the camera. While it's advertised as a wide angle camera, optimum installation should be about 15ft from your target surveillance area. The video capture is very clear, both at 320x240 or 640x480 resolutions. If you have an external mic and speakers, you can listen to the audio the camera's picking up and broadcast audio from your remote viewing location. If you're creative and technical, you can even configure the built-in motion trigger alarm to output audio through speakers upon trigger.Setup:As with my Easy N Tech indoor pan and tilt IP camera, I am setting this outdoor camera on a Mac OS X machine (as of this writing, OS X Mountain Lion 10.8.x). The set up was much easier than the Easy N Tech indoor IP camera since I've garnered a lot of experience configuring that camera. The following step works for both Mac and Windows users. If you've never set up an IP camera before, getting the Agasio up and running for the very first time can be a challenge as it only comes with a 2-page mini pamphlet with very basic setup information. The box claim that a full user manual is included in the CD-ROM with the software, but my CD did not work.To get started, plug the Agasio camera into a LAN via Ethernet cable. You need to do this to initially set up the camera. Then download IP Scanner for Mac by 10base-T Interactive or Angry IP Scanner for Windows and run a scan of your LAN for connected devices and their IP addresses. The new "unidentified hidden device" picked up by IP Scanner for Mac will usually be the IP address assigned to the Agasio camera by your router's DHCP server. Copy that IP address and load it into your web browser to access the camera's web UI. I found out the hard way that the Agasio's web UI is assigned to port 81 from factory, instead of the default web server port of 80. So after many trial and error, I finally gained access to the UI. If the IP address of the Agasio camera is assigned as 192.168.0.4 by your router, then you'll need to punch in 192.168.0.4:81 into your browser to gain access. Once you're connected to the camera, a pop-up window will request your user credential. Just type in "admin" for username and leave the password blank. You can set up the username and password in the web UI.From here, you can configure your camera to do a variety of options, including alarm trigger, uploading snapshot at set interval to an FTP server, etc.How to configure your camera for wireless access:The first thing you need to do is connect it to the LAN via Ethernet and configure your camera for LAN access, basically if you've got your IP Cam up and running by following my instructions above or through your own mean, you're ready to go wireless. Now the trick here is to keep in mind that when you go wireless, your wireless router will assign the IP Cam a new IP address via DHCP, meaning most likely you will not be able to access the camera at the LAN-assigned IP address. I think this is the main reason if not THE reason why a lot of folks are having a hard time getting the IP Cam to connect wirelessly. Also keep in mind that the IP Cam is only compatible at 802.11 a/b/g at 2.4ghz only. Not a problem with dual-band Time Capsule but you may need to configure your router accordingly.So back to the setup procedure, once you get your IP Cam up and running on the LAN, go to your IP Cam's web UI and click on "Wireless Lan Settings" on the left navigation menu to configure the IP Cam for wireless access.* Make sure the "Using Wireless Lan" box is checked.* Under "SSID", enter your full wireless network name. You may click "Scan" multiple times until your wireless network shows up on the list (you may need to scan up to 4 times before it appears) or you can just type in the name of the SSID of your network. If you have Access Control List enabled, be sure to add the IP Cam's MAC address to the ACL.* For "Network Type", select "Infra"* Under "Encryption", select your security type. It's usually WPA2 (AES), but again, you need to do the research on your own network.* For "Share Key", type in your wireless network access password.Click SET and let the IP Cam reboot (30 secs). Next disconnect the Ethernet cable from the IP Cam and power down the camera, wait 30 seconds. Reconnect the power supply but leave the Ethernet cable unplugged and wait another 30 seconds for the IP Cam to boot up. Now your IP Cam should be connected to your wireless network. Run IP Scanner 2.5 or above to discover the newly assigned WAN IP address on the network (you can find this in your router's DHCP list via your router's admin page as well); this should be the new wireless IP address for your IP Camera. If the WAN IP for the IP Cam is 192.168.0.3, then you'll need to punch in 192.168.0.3:81 to regain access to the web UI - again, your LAN assigned IP for the camera will usually no longer work. If you've changed the default access port for the IP Camera to something else other than 81, be sure to use the custom port instead when accessing the new wireless IP address. If you plan on a 100% wireless connection you'll need to reconfigure your port forwarding settings, reserved IP setting (if you did this for LAN), access port, etc. Proceed with your WiFi configuration as if you're configuring the IP Cam for the first time on LAN.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, poor phone support
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Connecting this camera to a computer and getting images was relatively easy.  The quality of the images is moderately good compared to other similar cameras I have used.  Accessing through a web browser, tablet, and Android phone was relatively easy.  The computer receives many frames per second but the other devices only see one frame every few seconds.  The main reason that I cannot give this camera 5 stars is that the user guide is written with VERY poor grammar and is difficult to interpret.  The camera comes with software that requires a registration code which was not included in the box.  I called the company (difficult to find the number is that was not in the box) only to be told that they had not heard of this camera model.  After 20 minutes of broken English I was told to send an email to receive customer support and that he could not help me.Update 5-5-12 - The email support was very helpful.  I recommend that over the phone support.  The email support sent me all the information I needed to download an update and active the software.  The new software is working well and does all of the features I wanted (saving movies, changing camera settings...).  I am very happy with the system now.

Reviews.Title: Great if you are experienced in installing IP cameras
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: My parents received this as a Christmas present.I was able to get the camera running on their wireless network but took about 30 minutes of trial-and-error to get the wireless security options correct.  The wireless connection seems stable with camera installed inside a storage barn approx. 150 ft from the wireless router (a Netgear N600-WNDR3700).  Images are clear and bright.  User security simple to update.  I haven't set up any of the advanced features yet (mail, FTP, or alarm settings) but these options are available.  Currently they can only access the camera images within their wireless network since I need to configure remote viewing.  Haven't tried any mobile apps but plan on using the iPad app.If the camera came with understandable English instructions and software, I would give this camera 5 stars. Documentation, EasyN web page and associated software is written in very, very poor "engrish" (I particularly like the 'succefully' status update).Will probably purchase additional cameras at a later time, to expand the coverage area.

Reviews.Title: Good outdoor camera but awful web UI and wifi setup instructions
Reviews.Author: E. D. Light "sleight42"
Reviews.Content: The Camera hardware:This thing is built like a brick $#@%house!  The upper casing feels like a solid block of aluminum.  Lots of IR LEDs.  Evidently, the lens is replaceable.  The base 6mm lens doesn't provide for the widest view angle.  I'm tempted to upgrade to a 2.5mm lens but for the hassle of having to install the lens in situ.The Mounting hardware:Respectable.  Provided robust enough metal bracket, three wood screws, and an adjustable arm.  I'm pleased with how easy the arm was to adjust and tighten.  The included allen wrench saved me another trip to the garage.Picture quality:The image is sharp!  But I found the colors a bit faded.  I understand that the IR-cutoff is supposed to be automatic.Setup:Getting the camera on your local network can be a little tricky.  I had to go to my DHCP server to find the IP address assigned to the camera.  Having the camera default to port 81 for HTTP?  I don't get it.  Port 80 is the *standard* HTTP port. This just causes more confusion.  In particular, connecting to an encrypted home wireless network was the most confusing part.  Read on.Software:The web UI is mediocre at best.  In particular, the UI provides poor user feedback. While setting up the wifi, I couldn't tell if the camera couldn't see the network or failed to authenticate.  This caused me at least an hour of agony.Mini Encrypted Wifi HOWTO:I spent at least an hour googling to find the necessary instructions.  First, once you've connected to the camera's web UI, on the wireless setup screen, you may need "Scan" as many as 4 different times in order to detect your network (assuming it's broadcasting its name/SSID).  Once you've found your network, click on it to set up the configuration. Now hit the "Set" button and let the camera reboot.  THIS IS WHERE THE CONFUSION BEGINS.  After the reboot, *unplug the camera*, unplug the ethernet cable, then plug the camera back in. After about 30 seconds, your camera should have rebooted and should now be on the wireless network.Overall:Beyond the low quality Web UI and the setup experience (lost one star here) overall, it's a solid camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it is
Reviews.Author: SteelJan
Reviews.Content: After several months of self-education, trial and error, my conclusion is that we home owners don't realize what IP cameras are good at and more importantly, what they are not.  All of the marketing right now indicates that this is the way to go, easy-peezy, set up the camera on your wireless network (as a computer systems design engineer, easy for me, perhaps not for others, I don't know about that point), and bingo, you can record, see your camera(s) with your smartphones or over the web on any computer with your username/password you set.  What could be simpler?  No wires, no mess.Oops, hang on, there is indeed one cable at minimum, the power cable.  And this camera is not 5V as is written in the description, it is 12V @ 1Amp (12Watts... if you're thinking solar panel & battery setup like I was, it's not going to be cheap).  But at least it has audio, mic and speaker, right?  No, it provides mic and speaker connections and leaves you to figure out how to make that happen, without any specs for either, I might add.But for me, what hit me in the face once I started running my experiments with this camera, and this goes for any IP camera, is that if you simply put it on your wireless network and want it to be viewable all the time and recordable just some of the time, such as with motion, you are eating up your wireless bandwidth.  Think about all of the ways you currently use your wireless bandwidth at your home, e.g. wireless gaming, watching streaming movies, making Skype calls, using a wireless server, etc, etc, etc.  Well, then prepare to eat up a big chunk of that wireless connectivity with your new streaming camera.Plus, this specific camera is just standard display, meaning in networking terms, the image is going to only be sharp enough to make out faces or whatnot from about 10 feet or so distance, regardless that the infrared lights can let the camera "see" much farther.  Those farther images are blocky & blurry.On top of that, those images are not "real time" even if you have nothing else using your wireless network.  I put up a stop watch and moved my hand in front of the camera.  With nothing else on my wireless network, my waving hand showed on the screen 20 seconds later.  With a movie streaming on my network and my better half using her laptop, my waving hand showed up on the screen between 1 minute to 1:30 later.  If you were watching your camera to see if someone was about to bash in your front door, well, my experiments indicate that they would have bashed in the door and grabbed you before it would ever show up on your screen.When I dug deeper into how professionals recommend IP cameras be setup, they recommend using ethernet wiring, not doing it wirelessly, that the cameras' ethernet cables go into a network switch that is also hooked up to a dedicated pc for live watching and/or recording.  All of the bandwidth used is on this sub-network.  So that little set-up is "real time" and the feed coming from it onto the internet is, yeah, delayed, but they are expecting you to only watch the delayed feed if you're watching via smartphone away from home, so it' just for you to be able to call the police.And get this, they expect you to only want to do selective recording and that's how they are not going to eat up a huge amount of bandwidth per camera, e.g. if there's motion, oh, but you won't catch the motion that happened that triggered the camera to come on because that takes some time, only what happens after that.  Sounds like how my simple game cameras work.Okay, so, think about not wanting a blocky, choppy image.  Want something better?  Then in the IP world, you have to go to an IP camera of higher megapixels.  But guess what... the higher the megapixels, the more bandwidth the camera eats up to transfer the images.Bottom line, I am going to keep this camera for another application.  But for home security, nope, I decided to go with High Def wired cameras, much cheaper for a whole setup of cameras and dvr, can watch them in real-time, zoom them, get audio, set up recordings, etc, and not anymore difficult than an IP camera because, hey, you gotta run power to those IP cameras anyway, it's not like they are really wireless, lol... and yeah, I can see my wired cameras via the internet just the same.

Reviews.Title: Very unsatisfied
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these cameras for my security system at home.One was bad right out of the box so I sent it back. I returned it and bought the same model. It was bad too. The first one was displaying very dark video even during the day. The second bad one , had non working Infared LED lights.Both of the bad cameras may have been used I suspect as the insignia on both of them was pretty worn. I will never purchase another product from Agasio.Very bad quality !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: mailbuggy
Reviews.Content: The reason I bought this camera was because I needed a decent camera that would send and receive from a long distance. I have the camera roughly 500 feet from the house, with a direct, unobstructed shot to the window where I keep my modem. It works great!  It takes a nice color view in the day time of the entrance to my driveway, which I can't see from the house without the camera, and a darker image at night in near complete darkness. Very impressive.The setup instructions are a bit funky, but it's easy to get past that. The software seems to work well.Just an update, August 2013: I have had this camera for over a year now and it still works like the day I bought it. Still love it.

Reviews.Title: Works well but I prefer the Kare N7502JV
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this and the Kare N7502JV. I prefer the Kare N7502JV at a $20 savings.  This camera was not as easy to setup, the menus are a little clunkier than the Kare cam.  It has an excellent picture for the cost.  Night vision works well in the chicken coop.  I was able to identify the culprit killing my chickens the 1st night.  The mount is adequate but only works on the bottom of the camera, therefore it is only mountable above a surface.  It is impossible to mount under an overhang.  Frame rate is slow over wireless but acceptable.  Using LAN cable improves performance but defeats the reason I purchased it, ease of deployment.  The documentation is poor at best and both cameras came with cracked CDs that still worked.  The guide on the CD is actually for a different PTZ model.  The internal web server works great.  DDNS us not usable if it is on your home network.  I was able to change the port to 8081 and put the port forward in my router and can access the camera via my android phone over the internet with ease.  The included software is confusing at best.  I played with it for about an hour trying to figure the new camera out but soon abandoned it for better software.  I prefer to use the free version of Vitamin D for alarming and triggering although it reduces the resolution. I am considering the $50 for 2 cams full resolution.  I have also found that ContaCam (open source) works well.  Lastly,  the Agasio has an internal alarm triggering connection and 2 way microphone jacks.  I did not use them so I cannot comment on the performance.  All in all, the camera is ok but I prefer the Kare camera in the same class.  I am considering purchasing another Kare for my monitoring needs.

Reviews.Title: NO SOFTWARE REGISTRATION CODE WAS INCLUDED
Reviews.Author: shalakoff
Reviews.Content: Camera itself is probably OK ($105, free shipping)Got it running quickly. The big concern is there was no recording software registration code included. Manual says it is on the CD or last page of the manual. Not present at either location. So I can not record. My review is based of the fact that recording software registration code is not included.Called seller, left a message. Four days later no callback.Emailed seller, four days later no email back.UPDATE: Thank you Amazon for helping me with this issue. Camera with the missing software registration code is back to the seller.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Hardware, not simple to install
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the price. In fact, nothing I have tried under $400 comes close to the features and reliability of these cams. The cameras seem to hold up to full outdoor exposure well. Six cameras inside and under overhangs and three cameras in completely exposed areas for the past 6+ months with no issues other than a couple of bad power supplies.(the power supplies are very cheap as you might imagine)That said, I have now installed 9 of these and have it down pretty well, but it is definitely not simple.Here are a couple of tips for install.1. Throw away the disk - it never works to find the cameras, software is terrible and barely in english, will just frustrate you2. Power it up and hold the red reset button for 30 seconds - I have had to do this on every single one of them for them to get an ip address3. Find the ip address it gets by going into your router and checking the dhcp leases, if you have a decent router it will identify the camera as ipcam_************_1(* represent a string of random characters) - if you can't find it that way, you can install a free software called "angry ip scanner" from angryip.org and scan your network using that.4. Use the ip address you find to access the camera in a browserThings I have found about the hardware that you may be interested in.1. The wireless receivers are weak. The signal where you install them must be very strong or it will drop frequently.2. Wireless performance is slow even in strong signal locations. (looks like stop motion video) Best I have gotten on wireless is 15fps, but average is 8-10fps.3. Video quality is very good on wired connections4. Field of view is very narrow. Almost all of my units lenses have been replaced with wider lenses as the fov was too smallIf you intend to record with this camera you will need software as the built in software is a mess. Invest in blueiris software. It is very cheap compared to other surveillance software, works excellently and will save you tremendous frustration.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera.
Reviews.Author: J. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera with little hope considering it's made by the same folks who make Foscam cameras. My fears were realized. This camera is junk, because you cannot turn off (or on) the infra-red (IR) filter!! I called support and they said there is nothing they can do and I had to send it back for a refund. Just an overall terrible experience and camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice hardware, horrible everything else
Reviews.Author: Mr. Applebaum "Larencium"
Reviews.Content: This camera looks very well built and sturdy, so my hopes were high when I unpacked it. There are no printed instructions, only a PDF on a CD. That wouldn't be a big problem if what's in the PDF was useful and intelligible. The PDF also doesn't allow printing or copying. And you get things like:"This method does not use frequently, when you process machine write parameter or program shift, we suggest you to use the first connect network method to process the modification of machine parameter."The instructions tell you what should happen (if you can decipher them), but give no advice on what to do if things don't work as planned. All in all, not very useful at all.An even bigger problem is that I couldn't get it to stay connected for more than a few seconds at a time. This is using an Ethernet cable with no fancy functions enabled. I did get it to momentarily connect wireless, but that was a very short lived event. I've been trying for days now to just get back into the built in web interface. I've tried with Safari and Firefox on a Mac (OS 10.6) and IE and Firefox on a PC (Windows 7). It will randomly connect and then a few seconds or minutes later just disappear. It can then go hours until it somehow allows you to connect to it again. If I can't even get it to connect long enough to set up and check a few parameters with a wired connection, how can I trust it to stream video wirelessly for security purposes?It's sad because it seems there is a lot of potential with the product. The actual video wasn't bad for 640 x 480 resolution and the night vision worked quite well. As with so many products these days however, the weakness seems to be in the documentation and software.I'm an electronics engineer with over 30 years experience. Although I'm not a networking guru, I have designed a lot of computers with both IBM and Apple. It really shouldn't be this hard to get a product to work.

Reviews.Title: Works well, easy setup, narrow field of view
Reviews.Author: Lobsterbuoy
Reviews.Content: Camera worked well at start and was easy to set up. Buyer should be aware that it has a quite narrow field of view.  I thought it went out of commission for awhile, but now I think it was a problem with my wifi network.

Reviews.Title: Instructions are poorly written
Reviews.Author: Randall
Reviews.Content: Instructions were poorly written and extremely hard to follow. The software included had 3 additional applications that were useless for the operation. Thankfully I also ordered a Foscam camera that had an operational application software and great instructions. I was able to get the Agasio camera working  using the Foscam instructions and software.

Reviews.Title: auto iris problem
Reviews.Author: xb2t
Reviews.Content: I installed the camera last September. I feel it is OK until recently. Under some special sunlight condition, maybe bright summer sunlight, the image will start blinking between a normal image and a dark image constantly. Basically you will see one frame normal and one frame dark and then back to one frame normal, so on so forth. This not only makes it annoying when you view the image, it will screw up the motion detection completely. So you keeps receiving motion alarm for every minute, even if the "motion compensation" is enabled. I searched the web for solutions. The Foscom discussion board claims it is a "known issue", and can not be fixed by positions, settings, etc. . So be careful!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Satnitespecl455
Reviews.Content: One thing to note on this product is that it is much larger than I expected! Not that it is a bad thing but I just wanted to note that it is considerably larger than most wired security cameras. It has good picture quality and fairly easy to set up on the wired connection. I am still working on the wireless setup but that is due to me loosing my info on my wirelesss router. Night vision is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: Lots of wires for "Wireless"
Reviews.Author: Marizel
Reviews.Content: I thought this would mount outside, maybe under the eaves of the garage, with a long wire to the power outlet, and then it would connect to my wireless router to send images.  When I took it out of the box, I saw that it actually had about a foot long pigtail of a bunch of connectors* (S-video, network, ??).  It has no actual electric wire and plug, just a wall wart adapter with a short cord to plug into it, so it won't work to run an extension cord to it.  I thought it would be more weather proof, but I don't think all those open connectors hanging out in the weather is what I had in mind, so I'm returning it.*See my customer image at:http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo1WZMFRO9J12WG/B0054VXG6A/ref=cm_ciu_images_pl_link

Reviews.Title: Agasio M105I - customer support horrible
Reviews.Author: anishap
Reviews.Content: Agasio M105I Outdoor Wireless Wifi Waterproof Bullet IP Camera with IR-Cut Filter, Two-way Audio, Night-Vision, Email &I tried to contact Foscam support for the last 5-8 days through email and phone. I got hold of them couple of times after waiting on the line for 3--45 minutes and then I was told that our Sr. Technician will call back that's it. Finally I thought of writing the product review so at least future buyers will undertsand what they can expect the support.The camera works fine and easy to setup. I was able to make it up and running in 30 minutes. Some how I was not unable to view multi camera on one screen, so I called them couple of times but no luck so far. Finally, I gave up after several attempts.Next thing was the power extension, since I want to mount the camera atleast 15 feet away from the nearest power cord I thought of getting extension cord. I emailed support and I got the below message.************We offer a 10 foot extension chord cable. If you are looking for a longer cable you can find them at any electronic or hardware store. no specific brand is recommended. Best Regards,EdwardFoscam Digital Technologies LLCSupport Team1-800-930-0949support@foscam.us[...]*************I ordered 2 10 ft cords  for my 2 cameras and it arrived pretty soon only to find out that it doesn't work with Agasio model 105I beacuse it has a different plug size. I don't undersrtand why the support person told me to purchase it. I returned both the cords today and I didn't find any extension in electronic shops like [...] and radio shack. Perhaps it need a convertor set if the size is different. Today I called the support again to find out whether I can get the extension cord. I was told that they will get back to me later.

Reviews.Title: for the money...great buy!
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I had zero problems getting this camera setup, although I have not purchased a mic or speakers to test out the audio.  I've read one other review that said that he wished the audio quality would've been better, which could be the external hardware that he purchased, or possibly his network.  When I have a chance to test it, I'll do another review.  Regardless, this camera was exactly what I was looking for in the same price range.  Good luck finding another one with good quality workmanship with the same options and the same price.

Reviews.Title: Setting up as wifi problem...with a solution
Reviews.Author: Billiardman
Reviews.Content: My wifi is complicated because I use MAC filtering for extra security. When I first set up the camera on my network, it seemed to be straight forward. While I had the camera connected to a cat5 cable, I logged into it and set up the wifi settings. I also made note of the MAC address in the "system info" screen. I then added the MAC address to my wifi access point's MAC filtering set up page. Everything seemed to be okay. I re-booted the camera with no cat5 connection and was able to connect to the camera via wifi. But I found out later while adding another device to my system, that I had failed to click apply when I added the MAC address. This actually had disabled the MAC filtering. Of course when I discovered my error, I corrected it. Only then to discover I lost the wifi connection to this camera. I disabled the MAC filtering to see if the camera would come back online, and sure enough, it did. So I re-checked the MAC address in the camera's "system info" page. I had the correct Mac address. I re-implimented the MAC filtering and again lost the connection. So once again I disabled the Mac filtering and the camera came back online. As a last resort I checked the device list in my access point. Sure enough, I discovered the actual MAC address of the camera was different then the address shown in the cameras configuration system info page. After I corrected the MAC address in my wifi access point. The problem was resolved.  Live an learn!Aside from this glitch, it is a very nice camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Overall, good bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: ChrisW
Reviews.Content: The Agasio M105I was a roll of the dice for me. My house sits back a fairly long lane and the garage/driveway side of the house has no windows. So, there's no easy way to tell if a vehicle has pulled down the driveway or if there is someone snooping around (I live in a rural area where most of the houses are empty during the day and the neighbors are just close enough to have you constantly wondering if the idling vehicle is next door or parked in your driveway).I wanted a camera that I could view remotely that had good resolution, night-vision capability and a fairly decent software package. This camera fits the bill with an outdoor rated enclosure, both wireless and wired ethernet network support and a decent web interface.It does have modest PC-based software support for recording movement and centralized viewing, but it's a bit of a hack (although it does a decent job of pretending to be a Foscam device). I've tinkered with ZoneMinder as a camera manager with this unit and, while I have had it working a couple of times, it tends to be on the flaky side. I might spend some additional time with this software as I am a "Windows-free" user...The built-in web interface is spartan, but functional with support for motion detection (I have it linked to my Gmail account, so that I get images emailed to that account whenever it detects motion above a certain threshold). It also has dynamic DNS support if you want to point a web browser at it or monitor it with remote software. The ethernet connection also supports direct to DSL connections with PPoE support.Wireless performance is pretty decent, if sluggish. My "G" access point is in my house at the opposite end from the camera and the camera itself is mounted on a detached garage about 40 feet from the house. Even at this distance, I get fairly smooth video when on my internal network and good refresh rates when viewing the camera on my 4G mobile phone. However, any additional cameras that I might add to the network will be hardwired to cut down on latency and the amount of traffic on my WLAN.An issue of concern for me is that the login credentials for the camera are not encrypted and passed as plain text. This is, largely, a non-issue when you are not exposing the camera to the internet, but this is the expected use in a home-owner's or small/remote location. It's not a deal-breaker for most folks, but be aware as it does present an attack vector for your network.Another small gripe is the uber-cheesy mount. In order to mount the camera on a vertical plane and point the camera at a 90deg angle to that plane, you have to add a spacer (like a block of wood) or replace the mount with a more substantial mount. Fortunately, the camera uses a standard mounting foot and screw, so nearly any standard mount should work.While this device doesn't hold a candle to the high-end HD IP cameras that I use at work, at less than $100 with shipping, there is little to complain about.

Reviews.Title: Reasonable quality for the price...
Reviews.Author: David I. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a general surveillance need in our neighborhood and have found it to be a fairly good camera for the price.  I did have a bit of a challenge getting it to recognize the wireless network (WPA2 personal) with MAC address filtering on an Apple Airport Extreme but was able to get it to work using the "Show passwords" function in the Airport utility.  I am still looking to expand the viewing area but that is not an issue with the camera.

Reviews.Title: The Agasio does not work with Macs
Reviews.Author: iPhoner
Reviews.Content: It was not clear that this product cannot be deployed from a Macintosh. Unless I find a solution, its going back. Besides that, the documentation was written by someone who needs intensive tutorials in English as a second language. If I ever get it working, then I'll review its functionality.

Reviews.Title: excellent customer service-
Reviews.Author: Joe Consumer
Reviews.Content: I had a snowballs chance in hell of setting this thing up--got ahold of Sean(?) in customer service and he quickly figured it all out--this camera works fine with a Mac---camera $99---cables $10--customer service = priceless

Reviews.Title: Very complex to set up and doesn't hold it's configuration if it loses power!
Reviews.Author: Darrell Jennings
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this camera.  It had all the right features, but set up is so bad that I returned it.  First issue is you have to have a Windows PC to set it up (we're only Mac here) so I borrowed a PC.  Then you have to plug the camera and PC into your router to configure the camera.  That required that I temporarily disconnect the internet service to the 42 network configured devices in my house since I had to disconnect my router from my network switch to have a connection available for the camera and PC.  Why can't they just have you plug the camera into the PC directly?  I finally got the configuration set up and the camera hooked to WiFi (one of the main features that they advertise that is NOT in the quick set up guide).I then took the camera outdoors to hook it up and the camera would not power up.  I called their tech support (which is not in the documentation they send...had to Google it).  I was told that if you disconnect the power to the camera it loses all the configuration settings.  How stupid can these guys be?  They apparently expect that you'll power up the camera and then trail a few hundred yards of extension cords behind you to keep the camera powered while you carry it to where you want to install it.  If you need to run it to an outside wall then you have to have your router immediately inside the wall since you have to disconnect the power to run their cable through a wall.  HORRIBLE DESIGN.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised
Reviews.Author: D wilson
Reviews.Content: My review is more of lack of attention/details. As some of use rely on these details to install.It says it's a 5v cam in the description, So I emailed Agasio prior to order, I get an email from Foscam.USAgasio M105I Outdoor Wireless Wifi Waterproof Bullet IP Camera with IR-Cut FilterHi,There are both of the 5V.Best Regards,UsmanLet me know how I'm doing! If you have any praises or complaints, please send them to feedback@foscam.us!Foscam Digital Technologies LLCSales Department1-800-930-0949sales@foscam.us[...]Now that I have 2 cams they are 12v DC, I tested the adapter and sure enough output is 12v DCJust letting you know Agasio, Foscam whatever... all the same people.I typically dont leave re marks but, here it is

Reviews.Title: Functionality WIN!
Reviews.Author: flyingmonkie
Reviews.Content: For what you pay, this thing has LOADS of functionality.  Have had it for a few months now, used outdoors, and love it.  Was using WIFI, but due to distance, ended up running CAT5... very responsive now.  The upload to FTP feature works great.  Had no problems during setup... just follow the instructions.  Am in the process of buying a 2.x or 3.x mm lens for it, as I need a wider angle.  Am hoping for an easy lens swap. :)

Reviews.Title: Died within 3 months
Reviews.Author: Ragai Meena
Reviews.Content: Do Not Buy!Died within few months. Set up was not an issue but keeps losing connection, and eventually died completely. Beware!!

Reviews.Title: Great tech support
Reviews.Author: Pete Albatross "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I had a good bit of help to set up the camera for viewing from any where with internet access. Michelle was the chat technician who made it happen.  They have 24 hour support and it was excellent for me.

Reviews.Title: RIPOFF now
Reviews.Author: Terry clark
Reviews.Content: i cant return it so i will try to sell it on craigslist they say it is for PC or Mac they dont have Mac software or browser for it online. They will not help you with third party software so your screwwed

Reviews.Title: My Agasio Cam
Reviews.Author: Tyler Petty
Reviews.Content: Cam works perfect for what I need it to do. I had trouble getting it to connect wirelessly, but with the help from the Service technician Mason I was able to get it up and going in a matter of minutes!!!

Reviews.Title: Too complicated
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Bought this a long time ago and it was delivered to the wrong address, so by the time it was found, I had already installed another camera. When I tried to install this one in a different location, I had to connect it to my computer to make it turn on. Then when it connected to it's server, it shut down and would not restart no matter how I tried. I finally gave up on it and stuck it back on the shelf to collect dust.

Reviews.Title: Does not work using wireless
Reviews.Author: LUIS ANGEL CARDENAS G.
Reviews.Content: I installed different kinds of cameras without any trouble except this one. They work fine using cables, but does no access the access point (Linksys).The camera does not have any lights for checking, I did 5 calls and sent emails to technical support, nothing happens, anybody answer my questions.I do not recommend this kind of product.

Reviews.Title: Great IP camera.
Reviews.Author: Andy T. Knote
Reviews.Content: I would give it a 5 star except- when there is snow on the ground I will get 50-60 emails a day, any shadow on the snow produces a contrast that the change detection software interprets as motion.  I have set it to reduce false alarms to the maximum of the devices capability,This thing has built in web server, built in DYNDNS notifier, built in email agent.  The software that comes with the camera is fair, and really not needed.  The camera will meet most peoples requirements with the features and servers built into the device.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good with some limitations.
Reviews.Author: Gaetano Andreoni
Reviews.Content: The installation CD was unreadable. In the web I found a tutorial so I learned that it comes configured with port 81, the only parameter I needed. Set-up was otherwise straightforward since I have other similar cameras. It comes pre-configured with a DDNS service. May be the unusual TCP port is an attempt to provide some confidentiality.Image quality is as expected. Field of view is smaller than desirable for my application but it is pretty standard. There is a latency when the alarm is triggered so fast cars are not caught at all. Good vision at night but long exposure time makes useless for id cars.

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: Barry Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: I have had this for a few months and it has a great true color picture. Had no problems setting it up wirelessly but now I have an Ethernet cable attached to it. I had to use videostream to get it the video on my website.

Reviews.Title: 1 out of 3 working marginally after less than a year.
Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: The set-up is a bit challenging for the tech-challenged, as has already been said. The quality is lacking. I bought 2, one was returned for replacement due to defects and wouldn't switch to night view. The other original developed the same problem, but was out of the warranty period, so could not be replaced. It now has moisture in the lens cover, and gives flickering picture in day and nothing at night. I bought another model (A603W) which seems to have better picture quality, but no audio features. It also has a wider field of view but objects appear to be further away. The other M105I is still working day and night but the picture color is washed out as compared to the A603W.

Reviews.Title: IP Camera M105I
Reviews.Author: Hut1
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical at first not knowing which camera to buy. I wanted something simple but that has access to Web so I can monitor the front door. I found this camera and so far really like it. Does well with low light imaging and the color is pretty good for day time. Wasn't sure how to setup the port forwarding, to use outside my firewall but installing the intranet web settings from my network was a snap.I called Foscam (maker of this camera) for online and tech support. I was able to speak with Allen Smith and he was really good at helping. In no time he was able to get my camera working, loaded Android and Apple apps help, and had my camera working easy.I am satisfied with the service and camera is working good. I just need to find a place to mount it now. Kinda hard with no way easy to run the power and cables.But for sure if I have any issues Im sure I can call and get more support.B

Reviews.Title: VERY HEAVY
Reviews.Author: biglove
Reviews.Content: Not small and not lightweight.Returned as it did not meet our needs; however.Construction does not appear to be top notch and would be a bit wary of using it outside?

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera however bad software and setup, viewing angles
Reviews.Author: T. HA
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera based off of reviews and research.  It's a great camera, however the setup was a challenge and the software isn't all that great also the viewing angles is poor.  Overall the camera has great quality and I just may buy another to cover another area of the property.  I haven't tried to two-way audio but I just may.  In all honesty I probably don't need a microphone but it just may come in handy.I wish this camera had a wider viewing angle like maybe 60-80 degrees instead it's 37 degrees according to the manufacturer.  Pan/tilt/zoom would be nice but at this price point you can't really expect those features.

Reviews.Title: 3 bad ones - just my luck or an indication of build quality?
Reviews.Author: Sean Riddle
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 Agasio M105I cameras.  One of them was obviously bad out of the box- trees were purple.  I guess the IR filter was stuck on.  I got a refund from Amazon for it.  Another worked, but would occasionally "flash" between normal exposure and slightly darker, about once per second.  The only way I could make it stop was to reduce the resolution to 320x240.  After a random amount of time (few minutes to few hours), switching back to 640x480 worked again for a while.  I eventually called Agasio tech support, but they did not recognize model number M105I!  Eventually they figured out which camera it was and had me return it to them.  After a month I was sent a refurbished camera.  It must have been a return that they hadn't even tested, since it was named "garage cam" and was password protected.  I reset the password with the button, and it's been working fine for a month so far.  The third camera was working fine for a couple of months, but has now also started flashing, so I guess I'll return it as well.  I was hoping that the refurbished camera had newer firmware, but both of them are 4.35.2.43, so I expect the refurbished camera will also start flashing at some point.It's a shame, since the cameras appear to be well built.  As the other reviews state, the mounting hardware is flimsy and rusts, but you can make it work.  The cabling requires installing a waterproof electrical box near the camera.  Using the Ethernet jack to connect it to my network, I get 7-8 frames a second.  Wireless with a strong signal, 5-6 frames a second.  Wireless with a weak signal, about 1 frame a second.  The cameras work well with iSpy, except the flashing brightness causes it to record constantly.

Reviews.Title: Not effective from noon to sundown (Light cycling)
Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: IP Cam experiencing image "flickering" from dark to light from approximately noon to sunset making motion detection ineffective. Mfg suggest adj res, 50-60hz, brightness & contrast. Only setting that would not light cycle was res. of 320*240. It will not operate at res 640*480 without light cycling, at least not outdoors.Last 3 nights camera will not transition to IR after dark until I turn on a porch light. Once the light is turned off night vision is restored.I need 3 more cameras but not sure Foscam is the answer.

Reviews.Title: very useful camera
Reviews.Author: M. Barra
Reviews.Content: working great during the day or the night. the transitions seem to work well too. image quality is nice, the settings are useful, but i use it with BlueIris so don't need many of the settings.wish you could turn the LEDs on or off manually.not sure how weatherproof it is yet, hasn't rained. i might add some silcone to the antenna connection to keep water out. maybe a little shelter of some kind to prevent direct rain hitting it.the 6mm lens is a little tight, but pretty flexible. the LEDs work surprisingly well but only under 20 feet or so.might buy another soon!

Reviews.Title: Works quite well but can be a hassle to setup
Reviews.Author: R. Fricker
Reviews.Content: I've had it about a year now.  It has been working outdoors temps from low 20s to 110F.  It has been almost in the open, not under shelter... so it is made well enough.  You simply MUST keep the many wires as dry as possible.  Twice it has gone out due to wires getting wet (I guess) and drying/cleaning the wires fixed it.  Now I have them well sealed and hung properly to keep water from seeping in.I find that logging on to my router is a must with the 8+ network devices I have constantly connected.  I believe I connected to the router directly and copied down the IP address it used.  Then when doing the wireless connection I used that same IP... however I may have been lucky (and I do apologize, I thought I reviewed this a while back and now I've forgotten some details).  I believe the camera might have connected on it's own (a few times) and gotten a new IP from the router just as you'd hope it would.  Power goes out and at some point I know the IP changed, but it still worked.I had the email working but after that last episode with rust forming on the Cat5 connector I didn't bother with it again.... I think it was sending too many email and I could not adjust the sensitivity well enough in a yard with many moving shadows (bushes and trees) to set off the motion detector.  I'm happy with it being in the back yard and the wireless working through brick and up to the 2nd floor through some walls.  Not that the signals necessarily travel that route but I'm saying it is not a clean/straight path from router to camera.Wish I could remember more details but being happy with it says it all for me.  I won't easily give 5 stars on most electronics and this would be 4.5 if I could give it.  The motion detection thing bugs me and the setup can be troublesome for the half star deduction.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but you need IP tech knowledge
Reviews.Author: Dr Rich
Reviews.Content: The installation manual and guide that is available for this camera are horrible.  Thank goodness there is information available online to help you set up the camera for your IP.  However, you need to be very familiar with your IP, router, modem setup and protocol in order to take advantage of the wireless capability of this camera.  So far, the camera functions quite well and the picture quality is excellent.  I would recommend this camera but make sure you possess the knowledge and understanding (or know someone who does) to be able to connect the camera to your network.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: ted woodruff
Reviews.Content: I have three of the M1051 cameras.  They do just what I wanted them to do.  That is good for me!

Reviews.Title: was okay while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Computerized Nurse
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. This was inexpensive and lasted about a year longer than I thought it would. I bought another Agasio PT camera to replace it...

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Khris
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice. Very clear image and night vision looks clear as well. It isn't easy to program as others have mentioned, however with that reviewer that did that step by step process on how to configure it, helped substantially. Great price as well. One note though, the camera isn't as bulky as it appears in the picture. It is slim and I'd even say somewhat compact, which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: Good IP Camera
Reviews.Author: garyedavidson
Reviews.Content: Connects Wirelessly to a weak signal with good results. I have not figured how to get a Date Time Stamp on the image. which would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: works well, but with narrow field of view
Reviews.Author: edrock "edrock"
Reviews.Content: Works well and as intended but viewing angle is about 60 degrees or so.  If you are looking for a wider angle you will need to change the lens or look for a different model with a wider angle.

Reviews.Title: Works Great! doest The Job for the price
Reviews.Author: Seimandi
Reviews.Content: Item its very good!Quality es fine!...its being working for 2 months now conencted 24/7EZ to use...plug and play!simple

Reviews.Title: Agasio M105i review
Reviews.Author: Marc Whittlesey
Reviews.Content: Camera was easy to install and setup. It works fine. The supplied mount could be a bit more robust, but it does work.

Reviews.Title: Works well but poor durability and poor instruction
Reviews.Author: Alan Hamilton
Reviews.Content: As others noted, the instructions can be hard to follow. I was able to get it working and used it about 10 months at a vacation home.However, it quit working. I noticed that the lens had fogged up from the inside. Taking it apart, it was clear that despite being "outdoor", water had gotten inside it and corroded the components.So, given the short life, I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: So far I have set up this camera using the wired connection and have been more than pleased with it's performance. The video quality exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Terrific IP CAM
Reviews.Author: Peter M. Portanova
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat apprehensive about purchasing the Agasio M1051 Outdoor Wireless Cam because of the low price, could it deliver good pictures. After owning this product for two weeks the answer is absolutely. I use the cam at the front door, during the day the picture is clear and sharp, at night I have an overhead light that helps the cam deliver a good picture.  When the light shuts off the cam continues to produce a quality picture, don't compare this to an Axis cam but I wouldn't spend $200 because the difference is not that much.  I agree with the other reviews regarding setup for WI-FI, mine did not have any printed instructions and the CD was not printable, but it helped.  I called customer service because I needed the registration number for the User Interface to stop asking me to register, don't do that.  You will wait from 15-to 30 minutes just to leave a message to have a tech person call you back.  I must say that I did receive a call the following day, but was not available.  I sent an e-mail to request a registration number and within a few days got one.  I think you will also enjoy the record feature, you can set up your e-mail and you will receive either still frames or a video if the cam detected movement, and you don't need the cam to be active on your computer, which the UI will say if you shut it down.  If I needed another IP Cam I would definitely purchase another Agasio.

Reviews.Title: Agasio camera does not support gmail/hotmail and isn't really waterproof...
Reviews.Author: Carlito
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Loftek pan and tilt indoor wifi camera that I have mounted outdoors. I mostly use the Loftek in one position, so I figured the Agasio would be better.On paper it should be. It's billed as waterproof, it has more LED infrared illuminators and it's more sturdy than the plastic housed Loftek.First thing - the camera itself is in a nice waterproof housing, but the connectors on the foot long cable bunch are all non-waterproof. Plan for a big waterproof external wiring box. Even the power supply is a cheap one you would use to charge a phone or similar device.The mount is also cheap. I imagine it will hold steady in quiet wind conditions but more than 15 knots I have my doubts.The camera is as with most of these things, difficult to set up. It took me days to figure out why it wouldn't send emails on alarm. It doesn't support hotmail or gmail, unlike the Loftek. An email address from say an ISP is needed.Field of vision is quite narrow, half the width of the Loftek.On the plus side it has a neat feature which is supposed to reduce false alarms due to lighting changes. The Loftek sends an email every time a cloud goes over. I haven't tried the Agasio yet as due to the several failings above I have to leave the Loftek where it is. Also, having set it up, it's quite reliable, at least on the test bed indoors.So overall, a decent camera let down by poor design and hardware choices.

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Missing Physical Manual
Reviews.Author: J. Morgan "bajajim"
Reviews.Content: I got the camera quickly and it is very solid although the included mount, though it works, is kind of "flimsy". But it does the job.It is heavy and seems very well made. There was no paperwork at all in the package, but everything is on the included CD. The only problem with that is the manual on the CD is on a .pdf file and cannot be printed. The print function is disabled, so it is impossible to print and refer to it while setting up.Setting it up with the included RS232 cable was easy and no problem. However, setting up the wireless is extremely difficult. Have to go into the router and activate a port (wrong port in the included instructions) and I finally had to go back and read reviews and ask a question to find out how to do this.As the camera will be set up at my home in Tijuana, I won't be able to try this again with the help from reviewers until next weekend. It would have easily gotten a "5 Star" rating if it was easier to set up the wireless.I will continue this review after next weekend at which time, I will again attempt to set up the wireless.

Reviews.Title: Good service
Reviews.Author: Mark Buenting
Reviews.Content: Works well from my spartphone.  I was happy with the price of the camera.  Calvin was able to help be navigate through the wireless and internet setup.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Agasio M1051  - Satisfied with service
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: ... very satisfied with the tech help (Simon) was very helpful, and made the installation easy.Patient service with good products ... I recomend. Good infrared.

Reviews.Title: Agasio M105I Outdoor Wireless Wifi Waterproof Bullet IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Olympic Peninsula
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery. Worked right out of the box. I have a similar camera that had the colors washed out but worked great. I saw this camera and read the reviews, so bought it for the enhanced color feature (True Color IR-Cut filter). After the IR-Cut Filter kicked in (overnight) it gave me the colors I wanted to see. The colors we sharp and beautiful. Wow, can't believe something actually worked as described. I was familiar with the setup because I had a previous IP camera that only took me a few weeks to get going. This one was a snap and I was getting pictures of activity from the camera by e-mail notification. The Camera is labled as AGASIO,however,it says EasyN on the box and the CMS software is also provided by EasyN but the Camera is sold by FOSCAM through AMAZON, The software needs a registration code for activation as described in other reviews. It says it's in the box but isn't, so don't contact EasyN for the code unless you purchased it from them, they don't want to hear from you. Contact FOSCAM,they will send you the code for registration. I contacted them and they sent me the code promptly.I am very pleased with the camera and for some reason, the wireless worked right away!. I am not sure how far the wireless will work from my wireless router, but I  moved it about 50' and it was still working fine. Impressive! My Apexis IP Camera would only work about 10' by wireless.Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: Catherine Foust
Reviews.Content: I was having trouble making the camera connect to my home network.  I contacted tech support sarah was able to remotely fix the problem and the camera works great now.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Happy Overall
Reviews.Author: Darrell B. Piatt "DBP"
Reviews.Content: I had a previous Foscam sitting on the corner of my house, watching my driveway.  It only lasted two years in the elements before losing its ability to hold the wireless signal.  I moved it to an inside location where it could be wired in.  This camera has a better picture and my connections are faster.  I haven't tried the audio features yet, however.So far, it seems to be a good value and I hope it lasts longer than its predecessor.

Reviews.Title: Good outdoor IP camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Simmons "Big Ugly Guy"
Reviews.Content: Only reason I deducted the star was due to the documentation. Other reviews address this already.Of prime consideration to me was finding a low cost IP Color camera that runs on 12V. This facilitates remote locations wherea Solar Cell can recharge a battery. I haven't tested how far the signal will carry, but notice another review which did. Nowto see how well this camera holds up to adverse weather.As for the camera itself, after getting through the setup and changing the password, I was happy with the quality of the image.There are cameras that provide higher resolution images. This camera should be used on your outer ring of defense/surveillance.

Reviews.Title: Camera could use better documentation
Reviews.Author: Ron_1963
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine for the most part.  The documentation leaves a lot to be desired.  Night vision works but do not expect much in the way of picture quality. For those reasons, I gave the product an OK rating.

Reviews.Title: usage as weathe cam
Reviews.Author: J. M. Markle "J.M Markle"
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to set up and use. The only problem I am having it trying to get it to link remotely on smart phone and with my weather program Weather Display.  4 days playing with it sofar and not progress so I can get it up and showing on website. Can view off the local ip so I know it works. The program that comes with it is an PITA.can't buy it and it shut down every hour.John

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera; Great Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Scrib
Reviews.Content: This camera does a great job of what it is supposed to do. I bought it because I saw a review here on Amazon.com that said it was an excellent buy and that gave detailed instructions on how to set it up for a Mac. When I received the camera, however, though it was relatively easy to set up so that it could be seen on my network, I had great difficulty getting it accessible to my public IP address. When I sent email to Agasio asking for help, I wasn't optimistic, but I got a response only a few hours later! That was great! After a couple of additional email exchanges, I eventually got a call--yes, a real phone call from a person, Calvin Harris--who logged into my machine and, after exploring various possibilities, solved the problem. That was a wonderful bonus! So I am very happy with a great camera and the great customer service!

Reviews.Title: Good overall
Reviews.Author: Alhambraguy "slaran99"
Reviews.Content: For what this camera does, it is a good value.I agree with what the other reviewer said about setting this unit up.  The best way is to start by connecting it with the supplied cable to your desktop or notebook.  These days you don't need a cross-over cable when connecting two such devices, so that is good.  The attached CDRom has some tool on it to search for the camera, but you can check out the manual for the default IP, login, and password.  You don't even need that CDROM and some of the error messages on it are in Chinese which is weird.I was debating whether to buy this camera or the $399 Sharx Security SCNC3605N which is 4x the price.  I figure I could try this one out first to see if it met my needs.  I would say that it does, except the field of view is kind of small.  Too bad it was not more wide-angle so I could cover my entryway and driveway.One clunky thing is the hood.  The unit is made of a nicely finished metal but the hood needs some tape to stay on.  It is somewhat difficult to snap onto the rails and it is easy to get it wrong.  I guess this is mainly for aesthetics or it might help keep the lens dry in the rain.I'm not even using the audio feature.  Nor am I setting it up to blast an audible alarm upon motion, but I assume it would work.  I set it up so that it emails me if there is motion and that part works fine with gmail.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Helimec
Reviews.Content: This camera has a good picture quality and fairly good picture in total darkness.  This was the first camera I have set up and I have limited knowledge on how to do it.  It was easy to set it up to view over my home network and a little challenging to set it up for viewing over the internet but I was successful with a little bit of reading.  This camera is not harder to set up than any other camera out there.  The software that comes with it is actually quite handy.  The software can be set up to let you know if the cameras IP address changes via e-mail, so you don't necessarily have to set up a static IP for external viewing, which by the way was all new to me as I was setting up the camera.  I truly did not know that your external IP address changed if your router is reset.  So if I can do it then clearly any buffoon can do it.

Reviews.Title: Agasio M105I
Reviews.Author: mark weiss
Reviews.Content: This is a well built camera, I was surprised by the weight of it. the night vision works great and I have no problem recognizing faces from 25 feet in total darkness, I don't know how far it reaches out because I have it angled towards the house and that is the furthest distance in the field of view. On the negative side the instuctions are really bad and the software that came with it is terrible. I ended up getting a copy of Blue Iris and using that. I haven't used the Audio because the laws for recording audio in PA are strict. Overall not bad for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: pete
Reviews.Content: Ordered another brand first, but had problems. I am happy with the agasio product.Could have less glare at certain time of day,better software and more informed customer service. I had to use product reg. out of example didn't have in papers. I use the cat5 wire it is more dependable in the long run for these types of cameras. These are good camera's if they had better software and wider area view would have gave more stars.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy an IP camera...
Reviews.Author: Ed B.
Reviews.Content: ...unless you have experience and tech training in setting up networks.This is the 3rd camera I have ordered in the past 2 weeks and I've not been able to set up any of them. They all appear to come from the same manufacturer, have the same software and the same LAN connection problems.The Chinese manufacturers and the importers of these cameras all claim "easy to set up" but that's not true, to put it kindly. These cameras are NOT plug n' play, they require tech knowledge that many, if not most, people do not have. If the manufacturer and the importers intend to sell these cameras on the American market they're going to have to actually make them simple to install and connect to LANs and provide understandable instructions. I'm not an IT expert (as you may have guessed by now) but I CAN follow instructions, and the instructions that come with these cameras are virtually worthless to me. I'm not even expecting access from a smartphone, port forwarding, or remote alarm. All I want to do is see the video on my monitor, is that too much to expect from the people who build it and sell it? The so-called instructions tell me to simply plug it in, click through a couple pages, and enter the URL in my browser. Easy, right? Not so much.I'm shopping for a wired camera now, no more IP cameras for me.

Reviews.Title: M105I Camera
Reviews.Author: RedEdwards
Reviews.Content: Physically nice camera.  Software less impressive.  Call line is useless.  Documentation is the weak link and a terrible shame since otherwise this is a nice product.  If you're patient, persistent, have some tech chops and the willingness to use them, it is usable.

Reviews.Title: Does not work with Macs
Reviews.Author: Dark Saga 66
Reviews.Content: Camera advertised as Mac compatible did not work with a Mac. My Airport Extreme router was unable to recognize the camera. Using IP scanner software showed an IP address but was unable to get the MAC address or any hardware details. Very generic packaging with no model or serial number makes one suspect it's not genuine. Tried to search for this model on Agasio's company website but it did not exist.

Reviews.Title: Not compatible with Airport Extreme
Reviews.Author: Lashes
Reviews.Content: Not compatible with Airport Extreme or Airport Express. You maybe able to setup with a Mac computer but not with Apple routers.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service is terrible
Reviews.Author: Lisa Holloway
Reviews.Content: I can not get the camera to recognize my wireless and have emailed support to no avail.  Last email from them was to call customer support to an international # in China.  Not happening.  Have one other possible solution and if it does not work I will be returning the camera.

Reviews.Title: Calvin fix my camera
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: The camera works very well wifi works will.I like the camer it tilts and tun to where I want to look.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Brian D Schmid
Reviews.Content: had an issue with the Foscam F19820W camera to set up wireless . spoke with customer service they arranged a call back .. spoke with harry Foster he was able to remotely access my computer and was able to make the camera work for me without any issuei love these camera as i have 3 of them

Reviews.Title: customer support
Reviews.Author: Cory Stepanek
Reviews.Content: i had an issue with making three of my cameras to work wireless , one indorr and two of the outdoors . spoke with customer support they arranged a call back spoke with harry Foster he was able to remotely access my computer and was able to make my three camera work  wireless for me . Harry did an excellent job and was very kind.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Slye
Reviews.Content: I was unable to log into the camera with the set password ... spoke with Harry Foster he was able to remote access my computer and was able to reset the camera and help me with getting the camera up and running ... This is a great company and their customer service is excellent... I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: John Lee
Reviews.Content: had a problem with getting it work remotely.. spoke with harry Foster he was able to remotely access my computer and was able to help me in setup the remote access of my camera so tht i can view the cam remotely .. He was extremely helpful and knowledgeable when fixing the issue. I would recommend asking for him directly when contacting Foscam support.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: had an issue to view the camera remotely . spoke with the technician Harry Foster he was able to remote access my mac and was able to help me in making my camera work remotely with a remote ip address...Quick and efficient set up. Knowledgeable and very helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: still working out the bugs
Reviews.Author: cooldietpepsi
Reviews.Content: Once I received the correct information to have it installed. The camera does not consistently record. some times it will not record at all and sometimes it skips 1-1/2 hours of the taping. The night vision is really hard to tell what is going on.I still have not received the information from the company to make it wireless it is supose to be wireless and mine is not working wireless.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
Reviews.Author: UpsetBuyerinMN
Reviews.Content: Does not come with instructions nor does it have a registration number which you need to set it up! No customer service number or help available!Waste of time and money!

Reviews.Title: Does not support 802 n wireless
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: The unit I received would not stay connected to PC and only supported 802 b/g networking.  I would not buy a product from this company again.

Reviews.Title: Not good enough
Reviews.Author: Stephen Hearn
Reviews.Content: Hardware is sturdy and looks of decent quality.  Mounting bracket isn't great.Web based interface is very low quality and not desirable.  The actual picture is okay.The PC based recording software is low quality and I couldn't find a license key in the packaging.  Contacted support and never heard back from them.  Ended up being  a waste of a purchase I should of returned it but I was too busy with work at the time and hoped they would respond with a license key.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: had an issue with the camera working wireless . spoke with harry foster he was able to remote access my computer and was able to make it work wireless for me . i recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Peter Woodmansee
Reviews.Content: Great product support.  Had an issue to make the video show up on the IE browser.  Spoke with Harry Foster who was able to remotely access my computer and resolve the issue with the cameras that i had.

Reviews.Title: agasio customer service
Reviews.Author: nml1991
Reviews.Content: was unable to make the camera work on t internet browser.. spoke with harry foster he was able to remotely access my computer loged in to thebrowser changdthe settings for the active x and there we had the camera up and running in the browser

Reviews.Title: Calvin Harris Tech support from Foscam
Reviews.Author: SAT_Winner "Terry"
Reviews.Content: Foscam FI8904W Outdoor Wireless/Wired IP Camera with 15-20 Meter Night Vision and 6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - SilverCalvin Harris from Foscam provided me tech support in getting my IP camera accessible remotely.  I had gone thru the same process number times unable to get it to work in a wireless environment.  He was quite able to identify the problem and quickly solve it for me.  Great job Calvin.  Thanks.Terry

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. Romolo Lerza
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera for my property and I searched the web up and down to find something that would deliver high quality at an affordable price, I found this one and from the description that camera has all I needed, and the price was very low, the only thing was to test it, and I must say that I am amazed from the quality of the camera, it delivers 100% on the description and even more.

Reviews.Title: One out of two worked right
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these and the ir cut filter worked as advertised and trees where green, colors like they should be. Ordered another and got the typical foscam type video camera with washed out image and purple/pink trees, sent it back...

Reviews.Title: seems like a nice camera
Reviews.Author: D. Rucker "Nashville Tn (Don)"
Reviews.Content: i was woundering if it has a built in mic...  on the mgfs website they say it does and here it does not.  The mgfs website also says it has pan/tilt but this web site does not metions it.  I'll let you know when i recieve iti received it and no mic or speaker but i'm enjoying seeing who is knocking on my door.  It has a pretty good picture.  It does not have a very wide angle but if you want that you will pay around $500.  Overall i am glad i bought it.  The iphone software will not allow me to see the cam on my phone unless i am on my network.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product!!!
Reviews.Author: nikhilboorla "nikhil"
Reviews.Content: I've already recommended this to friends, family, and neighbors because This camera works great and  I'm more than satisfied with this purchase. It was very easy to setup and install. The picture quality is also very great.

ProductInfo.Features:
IR-Cut Filter for true day/night color images (not washed out) - 640x480 Resolution; 0.3 Megapixel - Allows for remote viewing and recording from anywhere in the world through the internet
Hardened weatherproof/waterproof outdoor enclosure - Supports wireless encryption using WEP, WPA and WPA2 - Supports smartphones (Iphone & Android) as well as standard browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Chrome)
Two-way audio communication (mic and speaker not included) - Motion detection alerts via emailed images and FTP image upload - Supports DDNS for dynamic IP address stabilization
Supports M-JPEG video compression - Supports DHCP, fixed/static IP and PPPOE
24 IR LEDs for night vision up to 60 Feet (20 Meters) - Multi-level user management and password protection - Includes free 64 channel surveillance software
ProductInfo.Name: Agasio M105I Outdoor Wireless Wifi Waterproof Bullet IP Camera with IR-Cut Filter, Two-way Audio, Night-Vision, Email &
